channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Underdog rises: Dogecoin survived carnage in 2022 better than most
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: DOGE has performed much better than SHIB this year, despite the Shiba Inu community actively working on a L2 network, Metaverse and blockchain games.

item.title: 100%: Public Bitcoin miners sold almost everything they mined in 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: Publicly listed Bitcoin miners sold off nearly everything they mined in 2022 but appear to have started accumulating reserves once again.

item.title: Mango Markets exploiter arrested on fraud charges — Maybe it WAS illegal
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Felix Ng
item.description: The Mango Markets exploiter previously called his attack on the crypto exchange “legal open market actions.”

item.title: 10 predictions for crypto in 2023
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Mahesh Vellanki
item.description: Expect blockchain adoption to increase in the year ahead — in addition to the culture wars surrounding it.

item.title: Mark Cuban to Bill Maher: ‘If you have gold, you’re dumb as fuck... Just get Bitcoin.’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: The billionaire owner of the Dallas Mavericks confirmed to Cointelegraph that he practices what he preaches, stating he does not own any gold himself.

item.title: Wife of Hal Finney announces Bitcoin charity event
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: She said that the event seeks to raise funds to provide assistance for victims of ALS.

item.title: Argo blockchain suspends trading on Nasdaq due to upcoming announcement
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The mining company has faced financial problems due to escalating energy costs and the falling price of Bitcoin.

item.title: US Department of Justice probing $372M FTX exploit: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The current whereabouts of the funds remain unknown.

item.title: 5 altcoin projects that made a real difference in 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.description: 2022 was tough on crypto prices, but ETH, LDO, MATIC, DAI and ATOM all made a positive impact on the industry.

item.title: North Korean hackers are pretending to be crypto VCs in new phishing scheme — Kaspersky
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: State-sponsored Lazarus Group and associated hackers have had a busy year, and 2023 may see even more activity, the cybersecurity lab warned.

item.title: How to buy Bitcoin in Australia?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Christiaan Vos
item.description: Buying Bitcoin (BTC) in Australia can be done through crypto exchanges, ATMs and by trading with other parties.

item.title: Bitcoin Jack’s BTC trading is based on a list of risks and components
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Benjamin Pirus
item.description: When evaluating the crypto market, Bitcoin Jack looks at multiple components from a self-made list, basing his analysis more on timing than specific price levels.

item.title: What to expect from the crypto market in 2023: Watch The Market Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph
item.description: On this week’s episode of The Market Report, Cointelegraph’s resident experts discuss what we can expect from the cryptocurrency market in the new year.

item.title: BitKeep CEO says some users’ private keys remain at risk after exploit
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The blockchain executive urged users who downloaded the BitKeep 7.2.9. APK malware to transfer their assets immediately.

item.title: BTC price dips 1% on Wall Street open as Bitcoin miners worry analysts
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: A taste of BTC price volatility returns as United States stocks begin trading in the run-up to the yearly close.

item.title: Making the case that Bitcoin is not freedom: Pacific Bitcoin Panel
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joseph Hall
item.description: Is Bitcoin really bringing freedom to the world? Experts discussed the complexities of using Bitcoin as a tool for emancipation at a panel at Pacific Bitcoin.

item.title: Market volatility helps one crypto strategy outperform Bitcoin by 246% in 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph
item.description: A Cointelegraph Markets Pro score-based trading strategy reaped a 176% return in 2022 while Bitcoin plummeted 70%.

item.title: Russia's largest bank issued gold-backed digital financial assets
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: The issuance became the second major operations of the bank with the new class of assets.

item.title: Philippine SEC warns against unlicensed crypto exchanges amid FTX collapse
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The Philippine Securities and Exchange Commission highlighted that it’s illegal to offer Filipinos access to unregistered exchanges.

item.title: Crypto OTC trading to get traction due to FTX fiasco, exec says
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: The FTX crash could trigger a bigger demand for crypto OTC services as investors are looking for alternative crypto exchange methods amid weak trust in CEXs.

item.title: Bitcoin hodlers sit on record 8M BTC in unrealized loss, data shows
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: The amount of Bitcoin held “underwater” in wallets continues to increase, hitting levels never seen in history.

item.title: Top five crypto winners (and losers) of 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.description: Bitcoin and Ethereum are not part of the surprising list of five best and worst-performing cryptocurrencies for 2022.

item.title: Here's how Defrost Finance plans to refund users following $12M hack
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The Defrost team will conduct a scan of on-chain data to find out who owned what prior to the attack.

item.title: Bitcoin ASIC miner prices hovering at lows not seen in years
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: ASIC miners’ price per terahash has fallen more than 80% from its peak in 2021 as Bitcoin mining machines continue to flood the marketplace.

item.title: Community slams NYT for its latest 'sympathy piece' on FTX's Bankman-Fried
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The article bizarrely contrasts the alleged fraud carried out by Sam Bankman-Fried with gang violence on the Bahamian island of New Providence.

item.title: SBF gets prison advice: Shave head, deepen voice and listen to rap
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Martin Shkreli outlined that “Sam isn’t exactly gonna be somebody that fits into prison” and that he needs to rebrand himself to fit in and make friends.

item.title: DeGods and Y00ts NFTs are bridging off Solana: Here’s why
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: The migration of Solana’s top two NFT projects to Polygon and Ethereum is set for the first quarter of 2023, on an opt-in basis.

item.title: The real-life dog behind memecoin DOGE is seriously ill
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The owner of the internet-famous Shiba Inu dog posted on social media that Kabosu is in a "dangerous position" after falling ill on Christmas Eve.

item.title: Fidelity plans NFT marketplace and financial services in the metaverse
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Newly filed trademark applications outline a long list of possible avenues for the firm in the metaverse.

item.title: Robocallers have upped their scam game and they’re after your crypto
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Sophisticated malicious outfits are keeping up with current trends, turning their sights on crypto users following the bankruptcy of FTX.
